intro: Teucrium aureiforme, commonly known as golden germander, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a silver-velvet underside, and its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
